result.title: Main Advances and Challenges in Applying Artificial Intelligence and Big Data to Medical Imaging
result.introduction: The medical environment is undergoing rapid transformation driven by advancements in information technology, particularly through the integration of Big Data and Artificial Intelligence (AI) into medical imaging information systems. This shift is leading to significant changes in how medical images are processed, analyzed, and utilized for patient care and research.
result.main_body:
The application of AI and Big Data to medical imaging has brought about several key advances. There has been a rapid development of medical imaging information systems, with Picture Archiving and Communication Systems (PACS) evolving to offer enhanced compatibility, security, efficiency, and automation when combined with various solutions. A notable advancement is the active integration of AI with Big Data to improve the qualitative aspects of imaging. Specifically, AI PACS systems, which leverage deep learning technology to assist in medical image interpretation, have been developed through collaborations between universities and industries and are now being utilized in hospitals. Furthermore, many medical institutions are introducing next-generation integrated medical information systems as part of smart hospital services. These systems are built upon Electronic Medical Records (EMR) and incorporate electronic consent forms, AI and Big Data for precision medicine, and integration with external institutions. The goal is to establish patient information databases and standardize data to facilitate medical research based on medical Big Data. Future research is also focused on utilizing accumulated DICOM Big Data over two decades with AI and deep learning algorithms to enhance image interpretation rates.

Despite these advances, several challenges persist. The unprecedented progress in the automated collection of large-scale molecular and clinical data presents major hurdles in data analysis and interpretation. This necessitates the development of new computational approaches. Creating robust systems for the effective use of biomedical Big Data in Personalized Medicine, also known as Precision Medicine, demands significant scientific and technical developments. These include improvements in infrastructure, engineering, project management, and financial management. Additionally, the analysis of multi-view data requires sophisticated machine learning techniques, such as deep learning and cognitive computing, to extract meaningful insights.
result.conclusion: In conclusion, the integration of Artificial Intelligence and Big Data is profoundly transforming medical imaging, leading to significant advances in image interpretation, system efficiency, and the pursuit of precision medicine. However, this evolution also brings substantial challenges related to data analysis, interpretation, and the need for comprehensive scientific and technical infrastructure development. Addressing these challenges will be crucial for fully realizing the potential of AI and Big Data in enhancing medical imaging and patient outcomes.

PACS는 여러 솔루션과 결합하여 호환, 보안, 효율성, 자동화 등 새로운 발전 방향을 보여주고 있다. 그 중, 영상의 질적 개선을 할 수 있는 빅데이터를 활용한 인공지능(AI)과의 결합이 활발히 진행되고 있다. 특히 딥러닝 기술을 활용하여 의료 영상 판독을 보조할 수 있는 시스템인 AI PACS가 대학과 산업체의 협력으로 개발되어 병원에서 활용되고 있다. 이처럼 의료 환경에서 의료영상 정보 시스템의 빠른 변화에 맞추어 의료시장의 구조적인 변화와 이에 대처할 수 있는 의료정책의 변화도 필요하다. 한편, 의료영상정보는 디지털 의료영상 전송 장치에서 생성되는 DICOM 방식을 기본으로 하고, 생성하는 방법의 차이에 따라 Volume 영상, 단면 영상인 2차원적 영상으로 구분된다. 또한, 최근 많은 의료기관에서는 스마트 병원 서비스를 내세우며 차세대 통합 의료정보시스템의 도입을 서두르고 있다. 차세대 통합 의료정보시스템은 EMR을 바탕으로 전자동의서, AI와 빅데이터를 활용한 정밀의료, 외부기관 등을 통합한 솔루션으로 구축하며, 이를 바탕으로 환자 정보 DB 구축과 데이터의 표준화를 통한 의료 빅데이터 기반의 의학 연구를 목적으로 한다. 우리나라의 의료영상 정보 시스템은 앞선 IT 기술력과 정부의 정책에 힘입어 세계적인 수준에 있으며, 특히 PACS 관련 프로그램은 의료 영상정보 기술에서 세계로 수출을 하고 있는 한 분야이다. 본 연구에서는 빅데이터를 활용한 의료영상 정보 시스템의 분석과 함께 의료영상 정보 시스템이 국내에 도입되게 된 역사적 배경을 바탕으로 현재의 흐름을 파악하고 나아가 미래의 발전 방향을 예측하였다. 향후, 20여 년 동안 축적된 DICOM 빅데이터를 기반으로 AI, 딥러닝 알고리즘을 활용하여 영상 판독률을 높일 수 있는 연구를 진행하고자 한다.

queries.query: What are the main challenges in applying artificial intelligence and Big Data to medical imaging in neurology?

hits.title: Big data analytics for personalized medicine
hits.abstract:
Big Data are radically changing biomedical research. The unprecedented advances in automated collection of large-scale molecular and clinical data pose major challenges to data analysis and interpretation, calling for the development of new computational approaches. The creation of powerful systems for the effective use of biomedical Big Data in Personalized Medicine (a.k.a. Precision Medicine) will require significant scientific and technical developments, including infrastructure, engineering, project and financial management. We review here how the evolution of data-driven methods offers the possibility to address many of these problems, guiding the formulation of hypotheses on systems functioning and the generation of mechanistic models, and facilitating the design of clinical procedures in Personalized Medicine.

Highlights

  • Big Data are radically transforming Personalized Medicine.
  • Multi-omics, images, device data, and electronic health records represent the main big data types in biomedical research.
  • Cloud computing and HPC are the mainstream infrastructures for the management and analysis of biomedical big data.
  • Multi-view data analysis requires advanced machine learning techniques such as deep learning, and cognitive computing.
